How do I obtain the “Anomaly series” of a time series?

I have a time series of the Sea Surface Temperature (SST) of the Caribean Sea and I have to obtain the anomalies of that time series. Jan Feb Mar Apr May Jun Jul Aug Sep Oct Nov Dec 1948 24.786 24.767 25.117 25.514 26.565 27.374 27.778 28.022 27.827 27.308 26.545 25.620 1949 25.191 24.962 25.038 25.591 26.325 27.044 27.719 28.059 26.390 2010 25.058 24.769 24.735 25.528 26.745 28.046 28.406 28.859 28.692 27.858 26.761 25.273 2011 24.498 24.614 24.853 25.824 26.557 27.568 28.147 28.709 28.591 27.863 26.878 25.936 2012 25.054 24.927 25.096 25.646 26.457 27.417 28.011 28.399 28.493 28.129 26.740 25.966 2013 25.392 25.105 24.906 25.613 26.354 27.135 27.715 28.345 28.545 28.280 27.297 26.302 I've tried to calculate the mean every 12 months and subtracting it to each data of the year. I constructed a code in Matlab but when i plot the anomaly series, it still retains the annual variability. Code: y=data(1:792,1); %Data n=length(x); anomaly_tem=zeros(1,n/12); p=0; for i=1:(n/12) med_tem=mean(y((12*(i-1)+1):(12*i))); for j=1:12 p=p+1; anomaly_tem(p)=y(p)-med_tem; end end startDate = datenum('01-01-1948'); endDate = datenum('12-31-2013'); dat = linspace(startDate,endDate,length(anomaly_tem)); plot(dat,anomaly_pre,'color','black') xlim([min(dat) max(dat)]); datetick('x','yyyy','keeplimits') Some other way to do this?
